name: Contact
comment: Contains details of Individuals for whom the operator maintains information. For example, contact person for Customer, Subscriber, Financial Account, and Billing Arrangement.
vf short description: Contains details of Individuals for whom the operator maintains information. For example, contact person for Customer, Subscriber, Financial Account, and Billing Arrangement.

fields.name: ContactSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: ContactKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the contact in ALDM. Each contact key value represents a unique contact. Generated Key based on Contact Id

fields.name: SalutationInd
fields.comment: Specifies the salutation of the contact. For example, Mr., Miss, Mrs. Individual.title

fields.name: FaxNumber
fields.comment: Specifies the fax number of the contact. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: FirstName
fields.comment: Specifies the contacts first name. Individual.givenName

fields.name: MiddleName
fields.comment: Middle name of the contact. Individual.middleName

fields.name: LastName
fields.comment: Specifies the contacts last name. Individual.familyName

fields.name: LegalName
fields.comment: Specifies the full name, that is the concatenation of the first name, middle name and the surname. Individual.fullName

fields.name: EmailId
fields.comment: Specifies the contact s primary e-mail address. Individual.contactMedium.characteristic.emailAddress where Individual.contactMedium.type = email and Individual.contactMedium.preferred = true

fields.name: PhoneNumber
fields.comment: Specifies the contact phone number. Individual.contactMedium.characteristic.number where Individual.contactMedium.type = telephone and Individual.contactMedium.preferred = true

fields.name: MobileNumber
fields.comment: Specifies the contact mobile phone number. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: BirthDate
fields.comment: Specifies the contacts date of birth. Individual.birthDate

fields.name: ContactId
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the contact in the source system. Individual.id

fields.name: GenderInd
fields.comment: Specifies the gender of the contact. Individual.gender

fields.name: DeathDate
fields.comment: Specifies the date on which the contact died. Individual.DeathDate

fields.name: MaritalStatusInd
fields.comment: Indicates the marital status of the contact such as Married or Divorced. Individual.maritalStatus

fields.name: PreferredName
fields.comment: Preferred name of the contact. Individual.preferredGivenName

fields.name: Identification1TypeCode
fields.comment: Specifies the type of the first identification document that has been provided by the contact.For example, driver license, passport, and so on. Individual.identification.type where Individual.identification.primary = "true"

fields.name: Identification2TypeCode
fields.comment: Indicates the second identification document type of the contact.For example, driver license and passport. Individual.identification.type where Individual.identification.primary = "false"//Take the last value in case of multiple identification.

fields.name: IdentificationDocument1Number
fields.comment: Specifies the number of the first identification document that has been provided by the contact.For example, driver license number, passport number, and so on. Individual.identification.identificationId where Individual.identification.primary = "true"

fields.name: IdentificationDocument2Number
fields.comment: Indicates the second identification document number of the contact.For example, driver license number and passport number. The last of:Individual.identification.identificationId where Individual.identification.primary = "false"

fields.name: PreferredLanguageSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PreferredContactModeInd
fields.comment: Specifies the preferred contact mode for the contact. For example, Mobile Phone, Email, and so on. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: PreferredContactTime
fields.comment: Indicates the preferred time to contact. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was created in the source system Individual.createdOn

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was modified in the source system Individual.lastModifiedOn

fields.name: CustomerScore
fields.comment: Specifies the customer score. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: ProfessionalTitle
fields.comment: Specifies the contact s professional title. Individual.title

fields.name: ContactSourceId
fields.comment: Indicates the contact id used by CRM to communicate with external systems. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: ContactStatusInd
fields.comment: Indicates the contact status.For example:- 0=active- 1=inactive- 2=obsolete Individual.status

fields.name: MainAddressSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: FormattedName
fields.comment: The formatted name of the contact. Individual.formattedName

fields.name: BirthCountryInd
fields.comment: Country of birth of contact. Individual.countryOfBirth

fields.name: CurrentLocationInd
fields.comment: Temporary current location of the contact (may be used if the contact has approved its sharing) Individual.location

fields.name: NationalityInd
fields.comment: Nationality of the contact. Individual.nationality

fields.name: BirthPlaceInd
fields.comment: Place of birth of contact. Individual.placeOfBirth

fields.name: ResidencyTypeInd
fields.comment: Type of residency such as rent, own etc. Individual.residencyType

fields.name: ContactRankInd
fields.comment: Degree of importance of the contact to the service provider. Individual.personRank

fields.name: ContactInfluenceScore
fields.comment: Social influence score of an individual. Individual.InfluenceScore.score //Customization Instruction: There can be multiple influence scores per contact depending on providers. Either have a business rule to populate single score or add additional fields for all the contact scores.

fields.name: Identification1IssuingDate
fields.comment: Individual.identification.issuingDate where Individual.identification.primary = "true"

fields.name: Identification1ExpiryDate
fields.comment: Individual.identification.validTill where Individual.identification.primary = "true"

fields.name: Identification1IssuingAuthorityInd
fields.comment: Individual.identification.issuingAuthority where Individual.identification.primary = "true"

fields.name: Identification1PrimaryFlag
fields.comment: Hardcode to 1

fields.name: Identification2IssuingDate
fields.comment: Individual.identification.issuingDate where Individual.identification.primary = "false"//Take the last value in case of multiple identification.

fields.name: Identification2ExpiryDate
fields.comment: Individual.identification.validTill where Individual.identification.primary = "false"//Take the last value in case of multiple identification.

fields.name: Identification2IssuingAuthorityInd
fields.comment: Individual.identification.issuingAuthority where Individual.identification.primary = "false"//Take the last value in case of multiple identification.

fields.name: Identification2PrimaryFlag
fields.comment: Hardcode to 0

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
